content.title: Dark chocolate can help women cope with premenstrual syndrome (PMS) less painfully. This was stated by Indian scientists.

content.text: Every month, 3-7 days before the onset of menstruation, the level of estrogen and progesterone in the blood decreases in women. Such changes directly affect the level of serotonin, the hormone of pleasure. Further, the general picture of PMS is known to everyone - a woman suffers from irritability, depression and fatigue.

Dark chocolate can help reduce the severity of all of these symptoms. According to scientists, it contains magnesium and omega-3 and omega-6 fatty acids, which have a positive effect on a person's mood. In addition, there is no milk and not much sugar in this product.

Experts also urge girls during PMS and menstruation to give up foods that contain sugar, salt or caffeine and affect the emotional background. Scientists recommend doing physical exercise and walking more at this time.
